devstack and OSA environments.

subject: rt: pass nodename to internal methods
commit_message:
rt: pass nodename to internal methods

We would like to remove the resource tracker's nodename attribute and
have the resource tracker treat Ironic baremetal resource nodes like any
other consumable resource in the system. This means having the Ironic
virt driver register Ironic baremetal nodes as resource providers in the
new placement API and creating an inventory record of a quantity of 1
with a resource class of the Ironic node.resource_class attribute. The
problem we have is that currently the nova-compute daemon keeps a
ResourceTracker object in memory for each Ironic compute node in the
entire deployment (or a segment of Ironic nodes if using Newton and the
Ironic hashring functionality). We would like to have a single resource
tracker object that manages a set of resource providers instead of
having a resource tracker for each Ironic baremetal node.

This patch performs some initial surgery on the resource tracker to pass
a nodename parameter to a number of methods.  The first one up is the
simple internal methods:

- _set_instance_host_and_nodename()
- _create_migration()
- _claim_existing_migraton()
- _move_claim()

Once the internal methods are cleaned, we will modify the public methods
called by the nova.compute.manager.Manager object to pass a nodename
parameter and remove the resource tracker's internal nodename attribute.
This will allow us to only have a single ResourceTracker object instance
(and thus a single scheduler reporting client object) on the
nova-compute daemon. The net result of this should be easier to reason
about resource tracking, more consistency in how resources are accounted
for, and a smaller memory-footprint for nova-compute when running Ironic
deployments.

Change-Id: I1b99fa48cc7902887a939d25097704eab6bb9c7a

subject: Make get_partitions() work for partitioned disks
commit_message:
Make get_partitions() work for partitioned disks

In general case, attached disks could be partitioned,
and this leads to multiple records in /proc/partitions,
for my laptop which is:
evgeny@eantyshev2:~$ cat /proc/partitions
major minor  #blocks  name

   8        0  125034840 sda
   8        1     524288 sda1
   8        2     249856 sda2
   8        3  124259328 sda3
   8       16  976762584 sdb
  11        0    1048575 sr0
 252        0 1084366848 dm-0
 252        1   16650240 dm-1

QEMU adds block devices as unpartitioned disks, so that
we have 1 disk <-> 1 partition match. But this is just
an implementation specific coincidence.
Because the attached disk can have GPT table
and a primary partition covering available disk space, and in this
case it would mean 2 extra devices.

Namely, to run Tempest on Virtuozzo containers, we should allow for
partitioned disks attached.

CT-f9e98104 /# cat /proc/partitions
major minor  #blocks  name

 182   686608    2097152 ploop42913
 182   686609    2095104 ploop42913p1
 182   506688    1048576 ploop31668
 182   506689    1046528 ploop31668p1

Here we see 2 devices for each disk: root disk block device ploop31668,
and partition block device ploop31668p1. We only want to see
root device for each disk, not the partition ones, or
some testcases don't work
(test_verify_created_server_ephemeral_disk naturally expects
device appearance of 1 extra device).

Change-Id: Icd0043b661c41a51acf62cc07cb80c2e9bae56d4

The Nova code states that the default value for cpu_mode when using

actually tested in the gate due to [2], and with QEMU 2.6.0 it is

from hitting issues when this code is most exercised, i.e. CI
environments.

subject: Make CONF.debug also reflect on IPA
commit_message:
Make CONF.debug also reflect on IPA

Prior to this patch, setting the CONF.debug to True in the ironic.conf
doesn't enable the debug logs in IPA. The user had to also append
"ipa-debug=1" to the CONF.pxe.pxe_append_params configuration option.

This patch is changing this behavior by making the CONF.debug option
reflect on the IPA logs as well. As I understand, IPA is just an
extension of the Ironic code that runs in-band on the node allowing
Ironic to access the local hardware. This way, in order to enable debug
as a whole the user only needs to set one configuration option.

The code in this patch checks if CONF.debug is set to True and also
check if "ipa-debug" is not explicit set in CONF.pxe.pxe_append_params
configuration - to not overwrite the user configuration - and only then
will append "ipa-debug=1" to it.

The "ipa-debug=1" kernel parameter was also removed from the devstack
lib because CONF.debug is always set to True there.

Change-Id: I675fb11248d3789d45cf5905b7c15368f026b345
Closes-Bug: #1649561

subject: Wait for server to be active before deleting
commit_message:
Wait for server to be active before deleting

In ListServersNegativeTestJSON's setup, the comment says,
"# We ignore errors on termination because the server may
 # be put into ERROR status on a quick spawn, then delete,
 # as the compute node expects the instance local status
 # to be spawning, not deleted.",
and it is true that deleting a server immediately when it
is spawning will sometimes lead to ERROR status, especially
in complex production clouds.

Instead of just ignoring the error, maybe we can use a more
positive way, i.e., to wait for server to be active before
deleting it, thus the server should be deleted successfully
most of the time(if server is in ERROR status, then something
must be wrong).

Through ERROR server could be deleted if we delete it again,
but current tempest code won't do twice deletion(usually it
is not necessary).

subject: Fix remaining issues with displaying Glance metadata
commit_message:
Fix remaining issues with displaying Glance metadata

The idea is to split predefined image attributes into 3 groups
* basic attributes (self._attrs) which are constrained by image schema
  and are processed by Horizon in a special way, each key in its own
  fashion;
* extended attributes are the metadata which have special constraints
  in image schema, but otherwise are processed in general by Horizon -
  the same way as other metadata is processed;
* hidden attributes are the image attributes that are also constrained
  by schema, but should not be processed in any way by Horizon, so it
  does not need to know about them at all.

The above split seems to fix the issues with:
* displaying image's ramdisk and kernel ids when invoking Django 'Edit
  Image' dialog with GlanceV2;

subject: Use oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3
commit_message:
Use oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3

This patch replaces python standard base64 library call to
oslo_serialization.base64 to follow OpenStack Python3 porting
standard [1].

Use base64 encoding takes 8-bit binary byte data and encodes it. On
Python3, A string is a sequence of Unicode characters thus base64 has
no idea what to do with Unicode data, it's not 8-bit[2]. We use
oslo_serialization.base64 for python2 and python3.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8908287/base64-encoding-in-python-3
